title: Fed Still Cautious On Interest Rate Increase
teaser: After wrapping up a closely watched meeting on interest rates, the Fed says it will no longer be "patient" in starting to raise its benchmark rate.
contentencoded:
Federal Reserve officials today wrap up a two-day meeting with the announcement that it will strike the word “patient” from its statement about when interest rates will go up.

But the Fed also said it won’t hike rates until it sees further improvement in the job market.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson spoke with economist Diane SwonkÂ about the Fed’s announcement and what it means for the economy.

Guest

  • Diane Swonk, chief economist for Mesirow Financial. She tweets @DianeSwonk.
